title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Urban and Regional Planners

content.rendered:
What are Urban and Regional Planners?

Urban and Regional Planners review site plans and develop land use programs to create communities, grow populations, and foster other benefits. 

Where do Urban and Regional Planners work?

  • Local governments
  • Architecture agencies
  • Management companies

How much do Urban and Regional Planners make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Urban and Regional Planners is $53,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Urban and Regional Planners?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Urban planning majors
  • Environmental science majors
  • Architecture majors
Search Urban and Regional Planner jobs on Handshake

Urban and Regional Planner skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Urban and Regional Planners succeed in their work:

  • Good leadership and delegation skills
  • Interpersonal communication
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis

What are some common questions about Urban and Regional Planners?

Q: What majors are good for urban planning?

A: Some popular majors are: architecture, geography, environmental design, and landscape architecture.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming Urban and Regional Planners.
